info.solarflux.pickuptip: Tip: if you need to retain energy and items, harvest while sneaking.
info.solarflux.upgrade.efficiency: 增大太陽能板的FE發電量%.2f%%.
info.solarflux.upgrade.low.light: 在低光環境下生產更多的FE但在明亮環境下減少產量.

card.solarflux:solar_panel.name: 陽光
card.solarflux:solar_panel.text: You feel the warmth radiated from the solar panel nearby. Gain from %,d to %,d Solar Flux and 1 bonus draw. There is also a good chance you will gain 1 inspiration.
card.solarflux:photovoltaic_cell.name: Photovoltaic Properties
card.solarflux:photovoltaic_cell.text: You examine photovoltaic cell closely and carefully. Gain from %,d to %,d Solar Flux and 1 bonus draw.
research_stage.solarflux:solarflux.1: After some assembling of panels, I realized that I may be able to improve them using magic. And thaumaturgy may just help me with that!
research_stage.solarflux:solarflux.2: It appears that solar panels have an unusual aspect - Sol. It may be the key component of infusing them with magic.
research_stage.solarflux:brass_solar_pan: I've come to a realization that second solar panel may be magically enhanced using brass metal. It will be much cheaper but this will prevent this panel from being used to upgrade to tier IV.
Solar Panel II is easy to upgrade with brass. I think I will make an alternative path for solar panels using magic later on.
research_stage.solarflux:thaumium_solar_: Thinking more about solar panels I think that I'm getting somewhat better at their alternative path in magic. The next step would require me to use that thaumium metal, I suppose.

I have come to a conclusion that brass solar panel refuses to be upgraded with thaumium, at least on an arcane table. So I will have to force it with infusion matrix. Though this process would require Sol aspect and would be somewhat unstable.
research_stage.solarflux:void_metal_sola: I am starting to theorize that my thaumium panel's limits can be pushed even further! Now that I know about void metal, I may try to apply it on the thaumium panel I got.
The void metal seems to go well with the third tier of photovoltaic cells on infusion. Though this process is quite unstable, but the panel seems to be quite efficient.
